description:
In a world where ESP is common, only three people have them at the highest possible level. Those three are the special ESP team, The Children. The Children work for BABEL, a special ESPer organization committed to stopping crimes before they happen. Kouichi Minamoto is assigned to watch over them, and he'll need to, because three superpowered ten-year-olds are a problem on their own.

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/jetikariya50)

Acknowledged internationally for his work on [Yu☆Gi☆Oh!](https://anilist.co/anime/481/) and [Death Note](https://anilist.co/anime/1535/).

Famous for his depictions of fingers and the "Joey Chin" in Yu-Gi-Oh!.

Originating from Eagle Nest. Currently freelance.

Tanaka first drew attention for the wild and imaginative fight sequences in Precure [Max Heart](https://anilist.co/anime/1929/) and [Splash Star](https://anilist.co/anime/1534/). Following this he expanded his scope and took up work on productions all around the industry, showing that fights aren't everything he can do. His variety on running sequences, often showing an effiminate touch, as well as the particular attention to hair, down to all little strains and often involving a hairdo having a life of its own, are some of Tanaka's most outstanding feats.

__Non-anime credits:__
~!
- Chief Animator, Animation Character Design, Storyboard, Director, Animation Director, Key Animation for "BlazBlue: Calamity Trigger (OP)" (video game, 2008)
- Key Animation for "Disgaea D2: A Brighter Darkness (OP)" (video game, 2013)
- Key Animation for "livetune adding Fukase (from SEKAI NO OWARI) 「Take Your Way」" (music video, 2013)
- Key Animation for "Rurouni Kenshin: Meiji Kenkaku Romantan Saisen (OP)" (video game, 2011)
- Key Animation for "Valkyria Chronicles III" (video game, 2011)!~

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ushimou730) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/馬越嘉彦)

A highly prolific and respected character designer.

Originating from Monsieur Onion, where he spent his in-betweening days studying under [Hirotoshi Takaya](https://anilist.co/staff/117473/) and [Junichi Hayama](https://anilist.co/staff/140660/). In 1991, he moved to Studio Cockpit with [Hisashi Kagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120432/) and [Tatsufumi Tamakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/109607/). A few years later he debuted as a character designer on [Grappler Baki](https://anilist.co/anime/1859/) in 1994.

He is said to be a very fast and efficient worker, and according to himself, he much rather participates in TV productions than theatrical ones. Close friends with [Hiroshi Nagahama](https://anilist.co/staff/99346/) whom he often works with. They first worked together on [Juubei-chan 2](https://anilist.co/anime/636/), for which Umakoshi provided the designs for and served as the chief animation director on all 13 episodes. The following year, the duo teamed up again for [Mushishi](https://anilist.co/anime/457/), which's production quality was unusually high for a TV production. Umakoshi designed the characters and worked as the chief animation director on all 26 episodes of the series and hit a burn-out. After this he took a step back on major roles for a few years. Both him and Nagahama reprised their roles on Mushishi's revival in 2014.

In 2016, Umakoshi was appointed as the character designer on [My Hero Academia](https://anilist.co/anime/21459/), and has since been highly involved with the series' production as both an animation director and animator.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1178607902522654720)

Originating from Ad Cosmo. Frequent presence in the [Gundam](https://anilist.co/anime/2581/) franchise since 2007.
Known to be a fast and efficient worker. Often directing multiple works at a time.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nabeshin_afro)__ __Shinichi Watanabe__ is a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist for anime, while also being a voice actor. Shinichi is best known for his over-the-top adaption of Rikudo Koshi's [Excel Saga](https://anilist.co/anime/379/Heppoko-Jikken-Animation-Excel-Saga), in which he appears as the character Nabeshin. In addition to his appearance in Excel Saga and [Puni Puni Poemy](https://anilist.co/anime/564/Puni-PuniPoemii), his likeness has also appeared as NB in [Tenchi Muyo! GXP](https://anilist.co/anime/1133/Tenchi-Muyo-GXP), Inu-Afro in [Dotto Koni-Chan](https://anilist.co/anime/1684/Dotto-Konichan) and in small role in [Mahoromatic](https://anilist.co/anime/276/Mahoromatic). He also does an unmistakable cameo of Nabeshin, which can be seen in [Nurse Witch Komugi](https://anilist.co/anime/615/Nurse-Witch-Komugichan/), although Shinichi had nothing to do with that project. In addition he made an appearance in the show [EyeShield 21](https://anilist.co/anime/15/Eyeshield-21). More recently he made an appearance in episode 32 of [Hayate no Gotoku](https://anilist.co/anime/2026/Hayate-no-Gotoku). Shinichi claims that the nickname Nabeshin (which is an obvious combination of "nabe" in Watanabe, and "shin" in Shinichi) came from God himself. (Not to be confused with the director [Watanabe Shinichirou](https://anilist.co/staff/97009/Shinichirou-Watanabe), which is most known for directing Cowboy Bebop)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/jetikariya50)

Acknowledged internationally for his work on [Yu☆Gi☆Oh!](https://anilist.co/anime/481/) and [Death Note](https://anilist.co/anime/1535/).

Famous for his depictions of fingers and the "Joey Chin" in Yu-Gi-Oh!.

Takahide Ogata is a Japanese anime director affiliated with [Studio Add](https://anilist.co/studio/7408/)
Starting as an animator and becoming a director, he mainly handles TV series, with his specialty being limited animation. Together with a small staff based in a studio in Saitama prefecture, he makes children's anime, comedic works and many more.
Known to be a fast and efficient worker. Often directing multiple works at a time.
